name: d6: Dread Dice
description:
Description

d6: Dread Dice is an atmospheric puzzle game in which you, as a d6 dice, find yourself in a mysterious facility and have to sove puzzles, uncover the mystery and avoid "them" - the other dice.

Explanation / Devlog

This game was made for the Mini Jam 83: Dread on itch.io.

This is currently the result of ~4 days of work (I joined late when there was 1 1/2 days left for the game jam) with very little sleep.

This is my first game made in Godot after playing around in Godot for 3 days prior to this.

Haven't made a game in a long time and with Godot I had way too much to learn.

I got very hung up on many small problems and details. My time management was not good.

In the end I barely managed to finish half of the first level, though I got some (for me) tough to code mechanics done and a lot of visual work.

Probably focused too much on the visuals, but as I wanted to make something atmospheric, I kept getting hung up on details while the overall game suffered.

The textures are still terrible, but with some effects and lighting I think I at least covered it up a bit.

I plan to finish this game up a bit more in the future - but I really had to get something done now and need to get some Rest.

Credits

  • Game made by FGRaptor using Godot
  • sfx made in sfxr
  • Font Matchup Pro by Eeve Somepx
  • Music by yd

All assets are either made by me (FGRaptor) or available under their license.

Game availability

You can play it in your browser or download it. I only tested Windows myself as I don't have other systems, but I also provided Mac and Linux.
